SYSTEM: 06_Linking.pdf: Página 10
10 
Operators: aggregators 
19 
•  A comparison operator evaluates two inputs and 
computes the similarity based on a user-defined 
distance measure and a user-defined threshold. 
•  The distance measure always outputs 0 for a perfect 
match, and a higher value for an imperfect match.  
•  Only distance values between 0 and threshold will 
result in a positive similarity score.  
•  Therefore it is important to know how the distance 
measures work and what the range of their output 
values is in order to set a threshold value sensibly. 
 
Appendix: Installation guide 
•  It can be found at: 
-  https://www.assembla.com/spaces/silk/wiki/Silk_Workbench
